page.title: 08Eversley Village Pantomime
page.content: Last Christmas Eversley produced its own pantomime to raise funds for the village hall which is badly in need of repair. Mr. and Mrs. George were asked to produce it, since they had done so in the past.Mr. George started to write Puss in Boots in August, and in September the cast of fifty was chosen. Many other people helped backstage. The cast rehearsed once a week at the beginning and then three times a week. They borrowed most of the props and many made their own costumes. The pantomime was most successful, making a profit of Â£1,095. An extra performance had to be arranged to accommodate all the people who wanted to see it. A pantomime may become an annual event as so much interest has been shown.
